node.text:
To celebrate International Sustainable Gastronomy Day, chefs and heads  of restaurants awarded a MICHELIN Green Star are sharing some recipes with us that help make the world a little greener!
 
Today, it’s Chef @dominiquecrenn’s turn. At the head of three-MICHELIN-Starred @atelier.crenn in San Francisco, she chips in with this offering that is a  great way to eat up all those perfect summer tomatoes. Today’s recipe is for juicy, simple confit and marinated tomato salad – one of her favorite ways to enjoy this simple pleasure!
 
Yield: 4

Thanks for the recipe, Chef Dominique Crenn! 

Share your version with us 👉Tag @michelinguideand use #MICHELINGUIDEATHOME

node.title: MICHELIN Guide At Home - Dominique Crenn’s Tomato Salad

node.text:
To celebrate International Sustainable Gastronomy Day, chefs at the head of restaurants awarded a MICHELIN Green Star are sharing some recipes that help make the world a little greener!
 
To @massimobottura, it’s essential to “never let food go to waste.” The Chef of Three-MICHELIN-Starred Osteria Francescana shares this message of hope and goodwill in the form of his grandmother’s recipe for traditional Passatelli. In this recipe, the star of the show are humble breadcrumbs, which are for him the epitome of the “waste not, want not” food ethic.
 
Thanks for the recipe, Chef Massimo Bottura! 

Illustrations by @alice.vdw 
Share your version with us 👉Tag @michelinguide and use #MICHELINGUIDEATHOME

node.title: MICHELIN Guide At Home - Massimo Bottura’s Passatelli

node.text:
Today we celebrate International Sustainable Gastronomy Day with chefs and foodies around the world. 

We’re kicking it off with this amazing recipe for herb butter artichoke tacos handed to us from Chef Gary Yin, who helms restaurant King’s Joy in Beijing, 3 stars and a MICHELIN Green star in the MICHELIN China Guide 2021. 
 
Celebrate with us by making the recipe at home and share the results in your story tagging @MICHELINGUIDE and @legengaryin!
 
Serves: 4, 3 tacos per pax

Tip from the chef: You can crack fresh black pepper and/or a few drops of Tabasco for more pop!

Thanks for the recipe, Chef Gary Yin! 

Share your version with us 👉Tag @michelinguide and use #MICHELINGUIDEATHOME

node.title: MICHELIN Guide At Home - Gary Yin’s herb butter artichoke tacos

node.text:
Congratulations to @tsukiminyc on its MICHELIN Star! Chef-partner Takanori Ayikama chatted with @ericripert of Three Star Le Bernardin about hospitality and kaiseki with seasonal ingredients. 

Our Inspectors say, "The name Tsukimi references the mid-autumn harvest festival honoring the moon at its fullest and brightest. With that seasonal approach in mind, Chef Takanori Akiyama has created a deeply personal interpretation of a proper kaiseki meal. 

Thanks to our partner @wineaccess! #wineaccess

See the entire MICHELIN Guide New York selection for 2021 at https://bit.ly/3tL6PYT
and stay tuned for more of the 2021 MICHELIN Guide announcements.
.
.
.
#MICHELINguideNY #MICHELINSTAR21 #OneMICHELINStar#restaurant #chef #gastronomy #AllinNYC

node.text:
Congratulations to @franciebrooklyn on its MICHELIN Star. Chef-owner Christopher Cipollone chatted with Two Star Daniel chef-owner @danielboulud about Francie's modern brasserie vibes. 

Our Inspectors say, "Cipollone excels at balancing intriguing flavors and textures and his expertise on is on display in contemporary pasta dishes, his signature pithivier and the sauces that accompany each course.

Thanks to our partner @remymartinus! #remymartin

See the entire MICHELIN Guide New York selection for 2021 at https://bit.ly/3tL6PYT
and stay tuned for more of the 2021 MICHELIN Guide announcements.
.
.
.
#MICHELINguideNY #MICHELINSTAR21 #OneMICHELINStar#restaurant #chef #gastronomy #AllinNYC

Thanks to our partner @capitalone! #capitalone

node.text:
Congratulations to @donangienyc and @rezdoranyc! Each restaurant earned a MICHELIN Star! Chefs-owners Angie Rito and Scott Tacinelli of Don Angie and @stefano_secchi of @rezdoranyc chatted with @massimobottura of Three Star Osteria Francescana in Modena, Italy about redefining Italian-American cuisine and their favorite pastas. 

Our Inspectors describe Don Angie as "A modern Italian American menu with a true global flair. Think sourdough pasta and fior di latte mochi for dessert. They handle bold flavors with creativity and finesse." 
They say @rezdoranyc "offers authentic, regionally focused Italian fare. The quality and execution continued to impress time and again

Thanks to chef @massimobottura for this interview!

Thanks to our partner @caviar! #caviar

See the entire MICHELIN Guide New York selection for 2021 at https://bit.ly/3tL6PYT
and stay tuned for more of the 2021 MICHELIN Guide announcements.
.
.
.
#MICHELINguideNY #MICHELINSTAR21 #OneMICHELINStar#restaurant #chef #gastronomy #AllinNYC

node.text:
We heard from chef-owner @bazdarich of @xilonen.bk on their carrot tostada, veganism as sustainability, and corn in all colors and sizes. 

Our Inspectors say "this plant-based-Mexican concept named for the Aztec goddess of young maize. Guacamole here is folded with pistachio salsa macha verde. Heartier items include purple potato tacos with salsa cruda and cashew queso.

Thanks to our partner @sanpellegrino_us! #SanPellegrino

See the entire MICHELIN Guide New York selection for 2021 at 
https://bit.ly/3tL6PYT 
and stay tuned for more of the 2021 MICHELIN Guide New Addition announcements.
.
.
.
#MICHELINguideNY #MICHELINSTAR21 #BibGourmand #restaurant #chef #gastronomy #AllinNYC

node.text:
Inspired by a dish that is originally from the city of Hakodate on the island of Hokkaido, Ika Sōmen is the best-selling signature dish which tells as good as possible the story of @iyo.restaurant. This thinly sliced squid dipped in the egg yolk slowly flowing in the plate is enhanced with the expressive power of soba dashi sauce and caviar ; looking like carbonara in some ways.
Would you be ready to eat this sōmen noisily as the Japanese tradition requires?
 
🍴 Ika sōmen

📍 Milan, Italy
.
📷 Bruno Taddel

#MICHELINrestaurants #restaurants #gastronomy #foodies #foodiegram #instafood #somen #Japanesefood #OneMICHELINStar #guidaMICHELINIT

node.text:
From an audacious little dressmaker to her globetrotting grandson, @cotestjacques –awarded a MICHELIN Green Star– has established itself as a fine dining institution in Burgundy, France. There, chef Jean-Michel Lorrain likes evoking nature in his regional dishes. Those are full of generosity and composed of high quality ingredients.
 
In addition to sourcing their products from local producers, the entire team contributes to the harvest of fruits and vegetables in the 2000m2 garden facing the restaurant. There have also been several beehives for four years. They offer honey for breakfast and for the boutique of the establishment.
 
As a passionate cook and wildlife enthusiast, chef Lorrain created an association for the defense of biodiversity two years ago, a parallel but complementary approach to the eco-responsible work undertaken at the restaurant.
 
“We have refocused our sourcing, always favoring quality. There is no way that proximity justifies lower quality!"
 
📍  Joigny, France

📷 La Côte Saint-Jacques

Illustration by @alice.vdw

#MICHELINGreenStar #MICHELINSustainability #MICHELINrestaurants #restaurant #TwoMICHELINStar #chef #portrait #GuideMICHELINFR

node.text:
Today’s recipe is dedicated to one of the most traditional and appreciated dish of the Emilia-Romagna region in Italy: tortelli pasta filled with greens and parmesan. The combination of aromas and flavours created by the pasta, ricotta and chard will give all the goodness of a well-balanced dish.
Gianpietro Stancari, chef at @aidueplatani – Bib Gourmand in the MICHELIN Guide Italy 2021 – shares the secrets of fabrication of this Italian speciality, Tortelli with greens.  Measurement equivalents:
300 g= 10.6 oz
350 g= 12.3 oz
100 g= 3.5 oz
 
Tip from the chef: If you don’t have chard, you can use any sweet greens.
 Thanks for the recipe, @giampi1891!  Illustrations by @alice.vdw 📸 Vasini Marco/Trattoria Ai Due Platani

Share your version with us Tag @michelinguide and use #MICHELINGUIDEATHOME

node.text:
At the heart of Oslo, Norway, three friends have come together to create the pioneering place @restrestaurant– and were awarded a MICHELIN Green Star. There, the chef @jimmyoien and his team turns food waste into a fine dining experience. It is not a coincidence that the restaurant is called "Rest.", as this word in Norwegian doesn't only refer to a nice break but means “what is left”.
 
The team's mantra is “waste not, want not” and their ethos is based on using imperfect products and items which would normally be discarded. Acting in an nature-aware manner, the team works to use these ingredients in multiple different ways throughout the skilfully prepared and multi-course menu.

"No great ingredient should be left behind. Rest. is a rejection of modern consumerism. We turn food waste into a fine dining experience. But most of all we marvel in the abundance of brilliant ingredients that never reach a shop or a palate."
 Swipe right to check out the chef’s culinary commitments!   📍 Oslo, Norway  📷  Stian Broch / @matografen  Illustration by @alice.vdw

#MICHELINGreenStar #MICHELINSustainability #MICHELINrestaurants #restaurant #MICHELINPlate #chef#portrait #MICHELINGuideNORDIC

node.text:
One of the classics of @mocotorestaurante is coffee tapioca with homemade dulce de leche and 70% chocolate. You will be drooling over this delicacy!
 
🍴 Coffee tapioca, dulce de leche, 70% chocolate
 
📍 São Paulo, Brazil
.
📷 Repost Mocotó / @dangelofotos
#MICHELINrestaurants #restaurants #gastronomy #foodies #foodiegram #instafood #tapioca #coffee #BibGourmand #guiaMICHELINBRASIL

We continue our tour of France’s magical Île-de-Ré, and meet another local oyster farmer at @la_maison_henry 
 
For Guillaume Bourdin, oyster farming is a real passion that he coupled with his studies at marine school, making him a bons fide expert in the field.
 
Being environmentally-friendly, he takes care of his oysters throughout their life cycles, offering them the best natural environment right by the ocean. Guillaume has had to adapt to the growing demand for oysters, all while his success is at the mercy of the whims of climate. 
 
The oysters he raises do so healthfully in open marine parks located around the island. The result of his work is delicate oysters, in which salinity has a tremendous impact on the product quality.
Now, tell us about an eye-opening local product that you discovered during your own travels!

🎥 @manontarasconi
.
#producer #product #oyster #seafood #MICHELINrestaurants #gastronomy #localfood #MICHELINGuideFR

Chef @danielhumm’s masterful precision extends through the cuisine as it artfully unfolds before each guest at @elevenmadisonpark. Here is a stunning plate composed of a seasonal ingredient: eggplant. Do you like it?
 
🍴Roasted and grilled eggplant with shiso and coriander
 
📍New York, United States
.
📷 Repost Eleven Madison Park
 
#MICHELINrestaurants #restaurants #gastronomy #foodies #foodiegram #instafood #eggplant #soup #ThreeMICHELINStars #MICHELINGuideNYC

Today, we invite you the Île de Ré in France in order to discover an astonishing local product— and the man behind it.
Matthieu Duportal works in a 12th-century salt marsh using methods passed down through the years, making him a true heritage craftsman.

Fully aware of the ecological impact of his marshes, he makes sure they are a refuge for a very particular collection of flora and fauna biodiversity. His job is a treatise to the painstaking passion of a profession that exists at the mercy of nature’s vagaries. 

The salt he produces, fleur de sel (finishing salt), is harvested every day from the water’s surface with the utmost delicacy. A product of unrivaled finesse, fleur de sel is distinguished by its crisp texture. Now, tell us about an eye-opening local product that you discovered during your travels!

🎥 @manontarasconi 
. 
#producer #product #salt #fleurdesel #MICHELINrestaurants #gastronomy #localfood #MICHELINGuideFR

node.text:
Today’s recipe is about colorful and flavorful vegetable salad making for a perfect summer dish! Sprinkled with walnuts and a tangy raspberry vinaigrette, this spinach and raspberry salad is great for the warm weather months when you’re craving a light and fresh recipe.
Juan Arbelaez, chef at La Plantxa – distinguished with a Plate in the MICHELIN Guide France 2021 – shares the secrets of fabrication of his Spinach, Walnut and Raspberry Salad with us.
 
Measurement equivalents:
20 cl = 6.8 fl oz
50g = 1.8 oz
125g =  4.4 oz
 
Tip from the chef: if you don’t have any raspberries, you can use any other berries.
 
Thanks for the recipe, @Juanarbelaezchef!
 
Illustrations by @alice.vdw
Image supprimée par l'expéditeur. 📸Matthieu Khalaf
 
Share your version with us Tag @michelinguide and use #MICHELINGUIDEATHOME

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by MICHELIN guide (official) on July 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Ingredients For the pickles: 20 cl white wine vinegar 50 g sugar 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced For the raspberry vinaigrette: 15 raspberries 1 lemon 2 tbsp. olive oil 1 pinch of fleur de sel 2 sprigs of dill'.

Photo by MICHELIN guide (official) on July 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Ingredients For the salad: 125 g in shoots, washed 1 handful of walnut kernels 15 raspberries 30 grated Parmesan cheese Το dress: Shaved armesan cheese, at taste 1 pinch of Espelette pepper sprigs of dill 1 tablespoon olive oil'.

Photo by MICHELIN guide (official) on July 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Step 1 For the pickles: In a saucepan, boil the vinegar with the sugar and 5 cl ofwater. Pour over the chopped onion and let cool. tablespoons of the mixture aside. Put'.

Photo by MICHELIN guide (official) on July 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Step 2 To make the raspberry vinaigrette: In a bowl, put 15 raspberries, the reserved mixture from the pickles, the lemon zest and its juice. Add olive oil, fleur de sel and the chopped dill. Mash with a fork.'.

Photo by MICHELIN guide (official) on July 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Step 3 To make the salad: In a salad bowl, mix the spinach shoots with 4 tablespoons of the raspberry vinaigrette, walnuts, raspberries and grated Parmesan cheese. Dice the onion pickles and add to the salad bowl. Mix gently.'.

Photo by MICHELIN guide (official) on July 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Step 4 01 To dress: In a olate place the sala and add shaved Parmesan cheese, Espelette pepper, dill sprigs. Drizzle with the rest of vinaigrette and olive oil.'.
Photo by MICHELIN guide (official) on July 12, 2021. May be an image of text.
